報.definition: to report; to inform; to announce; to respond; to reply; to sign up for; to register for (abbr. for 報名|报名[bao4ming2]); to reward; to recompense; to take revenge; to retaliate; newspaper; periodical; journal; bulletin; telegram

報仇雪恥.definition: to take revenge and erase humiliation (idiom)

報仇雪恨.definition: to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)

報備.definition: to report a proposed activity to an authority (to obtain approval or register one's intentions)

報價.definition: to quote a price; quoted price; quote

報價單.definition: quotation; price list; written estimate of price

報到.definition: to report for duty; to check in; to register

報功.definition: to report a heroic deed; to mention sb in dispatches

報名.definition: to sign up; to enter one's name; to apply; to register; to enroll; to enlist

報名表.definition: application form; registration form; CL:張|张[zhang1]

報告.definition: to inform; to report; to make known; report; speech; talk; lecture; CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]

報喜.definition: to announce good news; to report success

報喜不報憂.definition: to report only the good news, not the bad news; to hold back unpleasant news; to sweep bad news under the carpet

報單.definition: a tax declaration form; a tax return

報國.definition: to dedicate oneself to the service of one's country

報失.definition: report the loss to the authorities concerned

報子.definition: bearer of good news (esp. announcing success in imperial examinations)

報官.definition: (old) to report sth to the authorities

報審.definition: to report for judgment; to submit for approval

報帖.definition: to announce good news in red letters

報帳.definition: to render an account; to submit an expense account; to apply for reimbursement

報幕.definition: announce the items on a (theatrical) program

報廢.definition: to scrap; to dispose of (sth worn-out or damaged)

報復.definition: to make reprisals; to retaliate; revenge; retaliation

報德.definition: to repay debts of gratitude; to repay kindness

報怨.definition: to pay back a score; to get revenge; to requite; (old) variant of 抱怨[bao4 yuan4]

報恩.definition: to pay a debt of gratitude; to repay a kindness

報憂.definition: to report bad news; to announce failure, shortcoming or disaster

報應不爽.definition: divine retribution is unfailing (idiom); one is inevitably punished for one's misdeeds

報戶口.definition: to apply for residence; to register a birth

報批.definition: to report for criticism; to submit for approval to higher authority

報捷.definition: report a success; announce a victory

報收.definition: (of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)

報數.definition: number off! (command in military drill); count off!

報料.definition: to provide information to a news organization; to tip off; information provided to a news organization; a tip-off

報曉.definition: to herald the break of day

報本反始.definition: ensure that you pay debts of gratitude (idiom)

報案.definition: to report a case to the authorities

報條.definition: report of success from a candidate to the imperial examination (old); list of deaths

報檢.definition: to submit goods for inspection, quarantine or certification; to register oneself to be examined (as part of a certification process)

報毒.definition: (of antivirus software) to report a virus

報班.definition: to sign up for a class

報界.definition: the press; journalistic circles; the journalists

報禁.definition: restrictions on the publication of newspapers; press restrictions

報稅.definition: to file an income tax return; to declare dutiable goods (at customs)

報稅單.definition: to declare to customs or to the taxman

報稅表.definition: a tax return; a tax declaration form

報考.definition: to enter oneself for an examination

報表.definition: forms for reporting statistics; report forms

報請.definition: to report, requesting approval; written request for instructions

報警.definition: to sound an alarm; to report sth to the police

報警器.definition: alarm (e.g. burglar or fire alarm); warning device

報賬.definition: to report expenses; to submit accounts

報銷.definition: to submit an expense account; to apply for reimbursement; to write off; to wipe out

報錄人.definition: bearer of good news (esp. announcing success in imperial examinations)

報錯.definition: to report an error; to give wrong information
